intro: Adinandra glischroloma, commonly known as the red-flowered adinandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
